Texto: 
sickle cell hgb - negative.
pt/ptt/inr - normal.
see factoid for treatment options.
mri brain:
t2 ax dwi: no acute infarct. 
t2 cor flair: bright engorged (slow-flowing)sulcal/leptomeningeal vessels - 'ivy sign'. 
t2 ax fse: basal ganglia flow voids.
t1 ax post gad: leptomeningeal enhancement marked secondary to leptomeningeal collateralization - enhanced 'ivy sign'.
angiography: not performed in this case. angio gives the pathognomonic 'puff of smoke' appearance for which the entity moyamoya is named. 
mra brain:
tof imaging anterior circulation: high grade stenosis or occlusion of the right distal internal carotid artery and its first order branches (circle of willis a1 and mca).
moyamoya
ivy sign differential: 
1) leptomeningeal metastases
2) hemorrhage
3) meningitis
4) high inspired o2
basal ganglia foci differential:
1) cribriform lacunar state
severely attenuated circle of willis:
1) subarachnoid hemorrhage
2) meningitis
3) tumor encasement
3 year history of episodes of left-sided sensory numbness followed by dysarthria and severe migraine-quality headache.
